SEARCH
Package oogasalad.engine.controller.camerafactory

Interface CameraFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
AutoScrollingCameraFactory, TrackerCameraFactory
public interface CameraFactory
CameraFactory is responsible for creating instances of Camera based on the given CameraData.

This abstraction allows different camera types (e.g., TrackerCamera, AutoScrollingCamera) to be instantiated without tightly coupling to specific implementations.

Common use cases include:

  • Dynamically creating a camera from configuration (e.g., a level file)
  • Encapsulating camera setup logic (e.g., assigning a target to track)
  • Supporting extensible camera behaviors through factory-based instantiation

Author:
Alana Zinkin

    Camera
    create(CameraData data, Map<String,GameObject> gameObjectMap)

  • Method Details

    • create

      Camera create(CameraData data, Map<String,GameObject> gameObjectMap)
      Creates a new Camera instance based on the provided data and game object context.
      Parameters:
      data - the CameraData containing the type and any configuration for the camera
      gameObjectMap - a map of GameObject IDs to their corresponding GameObject instances (used, for example, to find a tracked object)
      Returns:
      a fully initialized Camera instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the camera type is not recognized or invalid
      NullPointerException - if required parameters are missing in the configuration
